Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_AS29}Musanas sits just inland of the Gulf of Charas. Prevailing easterly winds from the desert means that the land grows dry quickly, but this allows the cultivation of aromatic berries ground up for spices.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_AS30}Pinlek
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_AS30}The oasis of Pinlek lies in a depression in the plateau east of the Bahr al-Yeshm. The farmland is bountiful but limited, and the land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the desert's short-lived but rich spring grasses.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_AS31}Kirkanli
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_AS31}Kirkanli sits in the edge of the Jebal Tarba, a series of mesas carved by ancient rivers. Pockets of groundwater, trapped by the shifting faults, water groves of date palms.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K6_1}Dinar
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K6_1}Dinar lies in the arid highlands east of Lake Perasos. Among the thorny scrub-plants of this land are several that yield resins and dried berries much valued in imperial kitchens.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K6_2}Karahalli
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K6_2}Karahalli lies in the rocky foothills that rise from the steppes east of Perasos toward the Devseg plateau. Although dry much of the year, the limestone soils of this land yield fine grazing for horses after the spring rains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K9_1}Kaysar
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K9_1}Kaysar is the center of a rural district on the southern slopes of the Akkan hills, where the spring rains bring forth lush grass that can support fine herds of cattle and sheep.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K9_2}Payam
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K9_2}Payam lies on the coastal plain east of Lake Tanaesis. Although relatively dry, the lands here get enough rain to allow a good crop of wheat.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K1_1}Fisnar
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K1_1}Fisnar lies in a dry valley to the east of the Devseg plateau. Though the region is poor land for most crops, its scrubby trees produce a berry that, when dried, gives a tang to the stews of the east.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K1_2}Ulaan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K1_2}Ulaan sits on a hillside in the Devseg plateau. Though the lands here are dry, the villagers here are ingenious at trapping the winter rains in small valleys and growing flax, a thirsty crop otherwise rare in this region.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K1_4}Asalig
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K1_4}Asalig lies in the foothills toward the northern end of the Devseg plateau where it starts its climb to the jagged Khar Ul mountains. Though it looks dry, it is prime grazing land for the sturdy horses of the steppe.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K4_1}Tepes
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K4_1}The village of Tepes lies in hills southeast of Lake Tanaesis, where fine oak trees much valued by the architects and shipwrights of Calradia grow in sheltered valleys.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K4_2}Kuruluk
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K1_3}Kuruluk lies in the foothills toward the northern end of the Devseg plateau where it starts its climb to the jagged Khar Ul mountains. Though it looks dry, it is prime grazing land for the sturdy horses of the steppe.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K3_1}Shapfestum
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K3_1}Shapfestum and its surrounding hamlets lie in the floodplain of the river Asacys just as it enters Lake Tanaesis. Salt can be harvested from the surrounding tidal flats.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K3_2}Hanekis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K3_2}Hanekis sits in a nook of a northern outcrop of the Akkan hills, overlooking Lake Tanaesis. The land is dry, but people still make their homes here to mine the seams of iron ore that can be found in the walls of the many ravines.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K3_3}Mazdum
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K3_3}Mazdum sits on the northern end of Lake Tanaesis. The terrain around here is relatively flat, allowing residents to create artificial lagoons to harvest salt from the lake's brackish water.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ1}Usekis
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ1}The village of Usekis and its surrounding hamlets lie at the center of the Devseg plateau, prime grazing lands for the flocks of the Khuzaits and their confederates.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K5_2}Okutis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K5_2}Okutis is a village at the center of a wheat-growing district on a narrow stretch of dry plain between Lake Tanaesis and the Akkan hills.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K5_3}Isbalta
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K5_3}Isbalta is a village on a rocky spur of the Akkan hills overlooking Lake Tanaesis, where there is just enough rain to grow a good crop of wheat.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K5_4}Bavata
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K5_4}Bavata is a village on the dry eastern coast of Lake Tanaesis. The shallow, brackish marshes are a good source of salt for the village and its surrounding hamlets.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ2}Okukhy
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ2}The village of Okukhy sits atop a pass over the Akkan hills. Many of its inhabitants live off the clay that can be gathered from nearby streambeds.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K1_2}Esme
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K1_2}The village of Esme and its surrounding hamlets lie at the center of the Devseg plateau, prime grazing lands for the flocks of the Khuzaits and their confederates.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K5_1}Khimli
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K5_1}Khimli and its outlying hamlets lie in a nook of hills on the edge of the Devseg plateau, and are known for the fine clay that can be gathered from their streambeds.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ3}Rarojan
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ3}Rarojan sits in a valley amid the jagged hills that rise north of the Asacys rivers. Its foresters harvest timbers and other goods from the northern woods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K4_2}Ransam
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K4_2}Ransam lies near the northernmost part of Calradia where it is still possible to grow grain. Although the local barley makes for a tougher, drier bread than more southerly crops, horses thrive on it, especially the sturdy steppe breeds.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K4_3}Mivanjan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K4_3}Mivanjan sits in dry hills overlooking the valley of the River Vithys. Rich seams of iron ore can be found where the streams cut through the shale and limestone bedrock.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K4_4}Urunjan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K4_4}Urunjan lies in pine woodland north of Lake Tanaesis. There is enough spring grass to support a hardy breed of cattle, one of the few that thrives this far north.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ4}Omrotok
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ4}Omrotok and its outlying hamlets lie in a nook of hills on the edge of the Devseg plateau, and are known for the fine clay that can be gathered from their streambeds.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K3_1}Hakkun
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K3_1}The village of Hakkun lies at the east of the Devseg plateau, in rough country scarred by ravines. Though it receives little rain, there is still enough runoff from the hills to grow wheat and other crops.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ5}Akiser
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ5}Akiser sits on the edge of the Devseg plateau, just before it gives way to the steppes of the east. The area is fine land for sturdy nomadic horses, some of whom are reared here, others of whom are brought by the mostly nomadic tribes to the east.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K2_1}Karakalat
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K2_1}Karakalat lies on the edge of a basin on the eastern slopes of the Devseg plateau, in land that, while dry in summer, gives forth good grass for grazing in the spring.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K2_2}Tismil
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K2_2}Tismil is the center of a rural district on the eastern edge of the Devseg plateau, where rain can be trapped in the many shallow valleys and wheat can be grown.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ6}Kiraz
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ6}Kiraz is the center of a rural district on the eastern edge of the Devseg plateau, where rain can be trapped in the many shallow valleys and wheat can be grown.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ7}Rokamil
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ7}Rokamil sits in a valley amid the jagged hills that rise north of the Asacys rivers. Its foresters harvest timbers and other goods from the northern woods.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ8}Tikser
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ8}Tikser is a village on the dry eastern coast of Lake Tanaesis. The shallow, brackish marshes are a good source of salt for the village and its surrounding hamlets.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ9}Ulslignar
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ9}Ulslignar sits in the rocky hills near the headwaters of the River Vithys. Seams of iron ore can be found in the limestone ravines cut by the highland streams.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K8_1}Erzenur
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K8_1}Erzenur and its outlying hamlets lie beneath a rocky ridge on the western edge of the Devseg plateau, in some of the steppe peoples' most prized grazing grounds.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K8_2}Gereden
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K2_3}Gereden and its outlying hamlets on the southern end of the Devseg plateau. Though rough country, it is known for the fine clay that can be gathered from the ravines.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K6_1}Karahan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K6_1}Karahan lies in in the foothills of the Koh Rohini, the mountains separating the settled Khuzait lands from their nomadic neighbors. The villagers here buy horses from the wandering tribes, and raise some of their own, making this the source for many of the steeds ridden by the Khuzait armies.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K6_2}Nutyuk
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K6_2}Nutyuk lies in a sheltered valley, near one of the last patches of pine and juniper wood before one reaches the endless scrub and grass plains of the east. Rare berries, dried and used as a spice, grow amid the trees.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_K6_3}Danara
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K6_3}Danara lies in the dry stony land as the Devseg plateau gives way to the endless scrub steppe of the east. The lands here produce little agricultural surplus, but the clay is much valued by potters and artisans elsewhere.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K7_1}Simira
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_K7_1}Simira lies on the eastern side of Mount Iltan, a volcanic massif that marks the boundaries between the Sturgian and Khuzait lands. The highland pastures are good for grazing, though winters here are harsh.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_K7_2}Kohi Ajik
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_K6_4}Kohi Ajik lies in a narrow, dry valley at the foot of the so-called Lover's Mountain, from which its name derives.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ10}Tsogeel
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ10}Tsogeel and its outlying hamlets lie beneath a rocky ridge on the western edge of the Devseg plateau, in some of the steppe peoples' most prized grazing grounds.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ11}Khureeman
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ11}Khureeman lies on the eastern side of Mount Iltan, a volcanic massif that marks the boundaries between the Sturgian and Khuzait lands. The highland pastures are good for grazing, though winters here are harsh.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ12}Kamshar
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ12}Kamshar sits in the rocky hills near the headwaters of the River Vithys. Seams of iron ore can be found in the limestone ravines cut by the highland streams.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ13}Mazuak
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ13}The village of Mazuak sits atop a pass over the Akkan hills. Many of its inhabitants live off the clay that can be gathered from nearby streambeds.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ14}Urdgmal
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ14}Urdgmal sits in a valley amid the jagged hills that rise north of the Asacys rivers. Its foresters harvest timbers and other goods from the northern woods.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ15}Khukher
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ15}Khukher lies near the northernmost part of Calradia where it is still possible to grow grain. Although the local barley makes for a tougher, drier bread than more southerly crops, horses thrive on it, especially the sturdy steppe breeds.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ19}Taoslan
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ19}Taoslan sits in dry hills overlooking the valley of the River Vithys. Rich seams of iron ore can be found where the streams cut through the shale and limestone bedrock.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ16}Turglar
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_KZ16}Turglar sits in a valley amid the jagged hills that rise north of the Asacys rivers. Its foresters harvest timbers and other goods from the northern woods.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ17}Chikyant
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ17}Chikyant lies near the northernmost part of Calradia where it is still possible to grow grain. Although the local barley makes for a tougher, drier bread than more southerly crops, horses thrive on it, especially the sturdy steppe breeds.

Settlement.name: {=CE_NV_KZ18}Khushuut
Settlement.text: {=CE_NV_INFO_KZ18}Khushuut sits in dry hills overlooking the valley of the River Vithys. Rich seams of iron ore can be found where the streams cut through the shale and limestone bedrock.
